A **scimitar** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **curved sword** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

## Generation

Scimitars make up about 1.5% of randomly generated weapons (on the floor, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), or in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")).

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), antique weapons outlets and used armor dealerships can sell scimitars.

Many [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") monsters are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") scimitars:

- [Hobgoblins](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin"), [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)") and [hill orcs](/wiki/Hill_orc "Hill orc") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a scimitar.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") have a 1⁄3 chance of being generated with a scimitar;[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Mordor orc weapons, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with scimitars.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of [Perseus](/wiki/Perseus "Perseus") on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") has a 1⁄2 chance of containing a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") [+2](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") scimitar.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Scimitar skill

| Scimitar |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max      | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                                       |
| Basic    | - [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")                   |
| Skilled  | * [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"), [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") |

The scimitar is the only weapon to use the scimitar skill. There are no [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") scimitars.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 296a3ac2](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/296a3ac246ae12218eccff46d3ef79f46eb9068f), the scimitar skill is merged into the [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") skill. Barbarians can reach Skilled in saber to maintain consistency with the former scimitar skill.

## Strategy

Scimitars deal respectable damage, but are not often used since most [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") with the skill prefer the upgrade paths afforded by the [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") or [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber"), the versatility of [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), or the sheer power of the [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock").

[Roles](/wiki/Role "Role") with poor starting weapons, such as the [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), might consider using a scimitar early on; [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") and [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") players might consider making use of a scimitar until they gain access to an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") or other means of obtaining artifact weapons. A few especially needy characters might find Perseus' scimitar to be the best non-[artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") one-handed weapon available.

## History

The scimitar first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Scimitar](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scimitar "wikipedia:Scimitar")***

A scimitar (/ˈsɪmɪtər/ or /ˈsɪmɪtɑːr/) is a type of single-edged sword with a convex curved blade that is often used for mounted combat. The term is European in origin, and covers an assortment of different "Eastern" curved swords inspired by sword types introduced to regions in western Asia by Central Asian *ghilman* (early Islamic slave-soldiers and/or mercenaries). These swords were originally derived from earlier curved swords developed in Turkic Central Asia (Turkestan), and the earliest evidence of their use dates back to the 9th century CE; among them is the Persian *shamshir*, from which the term "scimitar" is derived.

Though commonly associated with West Asian, South Asian, and North African cultures, various types of curved [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") have seen use in various other cultures, including several "Western" ones; more modern sabers are often distinguished from 'scimitar'-type curved swords by the cross-guard connecting to the pommel (end of the hilt). The scimitar serves a symbolic role in many cultures, both "Eastern" and otherwise - Akkadians and other Old Babylonian peoples viewed the the scimitar as a symbol of royalty or godhood; the scimitar also appears as a symbol of the Russians in the coat of arms of Finland, which depicts a lion brandishing a sword and trampling a scimitar.

In the works of [Shakespeare](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Shakespeare "wikipedia:William Shakespeare") and other classic literature (such as *[The Count of Monte Cristo](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Count_of_Monte_Cristo "wikipedia:The Count of Monte Cristo")*, which provides the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry), the scimitar serves as a symbol of the East and the Islamic world. This association has since gained connotations of "Muslim barbarity", with a possible root in Crusades-era religious propaganda: though the Muslims of the Crusades used straight-edge swords for the first two centuries, European Christians may have tied the cross-like shape of those swords more closely to their own cause.

## Variants

### Pirate patch

In variants that incorporate the [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") role, Pirates [know the scimitar](/wiki/Alternate_item_names "Alternate item names") as a **cutlass**. [Mayor Cummerbund](/wiki/Mayor_Cummerbund "Mayor Cummerbund"), the Pirate [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"), has a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a rustproof cutlass, and [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian") [pirate brothers](/wiki/Pirate_brother "Pirate brother") each generate with a cutlass. [Reaver](/wiki/Reaver "Reaver") is an artifact cutlass that serves as the Pirate [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift. [Skeletal pirates](/wiki/Skeletal_pirate "Skeletal pirate") are generated with rusted cutlasses.

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), the [skill system](/wiki/Skills_\(NetHack_brass\) "Skills (NetHack brass)") consolidates scimitars into the saber skill group.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") add the [high-elven warsword](/index.php?title=High-elven_warsword\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "High-elven warsword (page does not exist)") as a weapon that uses the scimitar skill.

Pirates know the scimitar as a **cutlass**.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds the [falchion](/wiki/Falchion "Falchion") as a [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") weapon that uses the scimitar skill - Barbarians may start the game with a falchion and scimitar as their weapons.

The defunct [Dancer](/wiki/Dancer "Dancer") role starts with a blessed +1 scimitar.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") consolidates scimitars into the saber skill group and adds the [orcish scimitar](/wiki/Orcish_scimitar "Orcish scimitar"), which uses the saber skill and replaces the standard scimitar for the starting inventory of non-undead orcs.

A scimitar can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") and a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"). Scimitars can be used at a forge to create various weapons:

- Combining a scimitar with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") creates a [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident").
- Combining a scimitar with a long sword creates a saber.
- Combining a scimitar with a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") creates a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword").
- Combining a scimitar with an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword") creates an [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [Corsairs](/wiki/Corsair "Corsair") start the game with a +1 cutlass, and use the same alternate item names as Pirates do.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds the falchion from SpliceHack and the orcish scimitar from EvilHack, and the scimitar skill is merged into the saber skill. Barbarians can start with a falchion and scimitar as in SpliceHack.

A falchion can be created at a forge by combining two scimitars.

## Encyclopedia entry

Oh, how handsome, how noble was the Vizier Ali Tebelin,  
my father, as he stood there in the midst of the shot, his  
scimitar in his hand, his face black with powder! How his  
enemies fled before him!

\[ The Count of Monte Cristo, by Alexandre Dumas ]

4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [dat/medusa.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 56](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/medusa.des#L56)

General stores, antique weapons outlets and used armor dealerships can sell scimitars.

The statue of Perseus on Medusa's Island has a 1⁄2 chance of containing a blessed +2 scimitar.[4][5][6][7]

Roles with poor starting weapons, such as the Tourist, might consider using a scimitar early on; illiterate and wishless conduct players might consider making use of a scimitar until they gain access to an altar or other means of obtaining artifact weapons. ===Pirate patch===
In variants that incorporate the [[Pirate]] role, Pirates [[Alternate item names|know the scimitar]] as a '''cutlass'''. [[Mayor Cummerbund]], the Pirate [[quest leader]], has a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a rustproof cutlass, and [[quest guardian]] [[pirate brother]]s each generate with a cutlass. [[Reaver]] is an artifact cutlass that serves as the Pirate [[crowning]] gift. [[Skeletal pirate]]s are generated with rusted cutlasses.

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], the [[Skills (NetHack brass)|skill system]] consolidates scimitars into the saber skill group.

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]] add the [[high-elven warsword]] as a weapon that uses the scimitar skill.

Pirates know the scimitar as a '''cutlass'''.

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds the [[falchion]] as a [[two-handed]] weapon that uses the scimitar skill - Barbarians may start the game with a falchion and scimitar as their weapons.

The defunct [[Dancer]] role starts with a blessed +1 scimitar.

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] consolidates scimitars into the saber skill group and adds the [[orcish scimitar]], which uses the saber skill and replaces the standard scimitar for the starting inventory of non-undead orcs.

A scimitar can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[short sword]] and a [[knife]]. Scimitars can be used at a forge to create various weapons:

* Combining a scimitar with a [[spear]] creates a [[trident]].
* Combining a scimitar with a long sword creates a saber.
* Combining a scimitar with a [[short sword]] creates a [[broadsword]].
* Combining a scimitar with an [[elven short sword]] creates an [[elven broadsword]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], [[Corsair]]s start the game with a +1 cutlass, and use the same alternate item names as Pirates do.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds the falchion from SpliceHack and the orcish scimitar from EvilHack, and the scimitar skill is merged into the saber skill. Barbarians can start with a falchion and scimitar as in SpliceHack.

A falchion can be created at a forge by combining two scimitars.
